00034     //supply suitable increment functions for the iterators:
00035     template <class SCALARTYPE, typename F, unsigned int ALIGNMENT>
00036     struct MATRIX_ITERATOR_INCREMENTER<viennacl::row_iteration, viennacl::matrix<SCALARTYPE, F, ALIGNMENT> >
00037     {
00038       static void apply(const viennacl::matrix<SCALARTYPE, F, ALIGNMENT> & mat, unsigned int & row, unsigned int & col) { ++row; }
00039     };
00040 
00041     template <class SCALARTYPE, typename F, unsigned int ALIGNMENT>
00042     struct MATRIX_ITERATOR_INCREMENTER<viennacl::col_iteration, viennacl::matrix<SCALARTYPE, F, ALIGNMENT> >
00043     {
00044       static void apply(const viennacl::matrix<SCALARTYPE, F, ALIGNMENT> & mat, unsigned int & row, unsigned int & col) { ++col; }
00045     };

00050     struct enable_if
00051     {
00052       typedef T   type;

00055     template <class T> 
00056     struct enable_if<false, T> {};

00061     struct CHECK_SCALAR_TEMPLATE_ARGUMENT
00062     {
00063         typedef typename T::ERROR_SCALAR_MUST_HAVE_TEMPLATE_ARGUMENT_FLOAT_OR_DOUBLE  ResultType;
00064     };
00065

00067     struct CHECK_SCALAR_TEMPLATE_ARGUMENT<float>
00068     {
00069         typedef float  ResultType;
00070     };

00073     struct CHECK_SCALAR_TEMPLATE_ARGUMENT<double>
00074     {
00075         typedef double  ResultType;

00085     std::string readTextFromFile(const std::string & filename)
00086     {
00087       std::ifstream f(filename.c_str());
00088       if (!f) return std::string();
00089 
00090       std::stringstream result;
00091       std::string tmp;
00092       while (getline(f, tmp))
00093         result << tmp << std::endl;
00094 
00095       return result.str();
00096     }
00097 
00105     std::string strReplace(const std::string & text, std::string to_search, std::string to_replace)
00106     {
00107       std::string::size_type pos=0;
00108         std::string result;
00109         std::string::size_type found;
00110         while( (found = text.find(to_search, pos)) != std::string::npos )
00111         {
00112         result.append(text.substr(pos,found-pos));
00113             result.append(to_replace);
00114             pos = found + to_search.length();
00115         }
00116         if (pos < text.length())
00117             result.append(text.substr(pos));
00118         return result;
00119     }
00120 
00128     template <class INT_TYPE>
00129     INT_TYPE roundUpToNextMultiple(INT_TYPE to_reach, INT_TYPE base)
00130     {
00131       if (to_reach % base == 0) return to_reach;
00132       return ((to_reach / base) + 1) * base;
00133     }
00134     
00135     
00141     std::string make_double_kernel(std::string const & source)
00142     {
00143       #ifdef VIENNACL_EXPERIMENTAL_DOUBLE_PRECISION_WITH_STREAM_SDK
00144         std::string result = "#pragma OPENCL EXTENSION cl_amd_fp64 : enable\n\n";
00145       #else
00146         std::string result = "#pragma OPENCL EXTENSION cl_khr_fp64 : enable\n\n";
00147       #endif
00148       result.append(strReplace(source, "float", "double"));
00149       return result;
00150     }

00153     template <typename T>
00154     struct CONST_REMOVER
00155     {
00156       typedef T   ResultType;
00157     };
00158 
00159     template <typename T>
00160     struct CONST_REMOVER<const T>
00161     {
00162       typedef T   ResultType;
00163     };

00171     template <typename LHS, typename RHS>
00172     struct VECTOR_EXTRACTOR_IMPL
00173     {
00174       typedef typename LHS::ERROR_COULD_NOT_EXTRACT_VECTOR_INFORMATION_FROM_VECTOR_EXPRESSION  ResultType;
00175     };
00176     
00177     template <typename LHS, typename ScalarType, unsigned int A>
00178     struct VECTOR_EXTRACTOR_IMPL<LHS, viennacl::vector<ScalarType, A> >
00179     {
00180       typedef viennacl::vector<ScalarType, A>   ResultType;
00181     };
00182 
00183     template <typename RHS, typename ScalarType, unsigned int A>
00184     struct VECTOR_EXTRACTOR_IMPL<viennacl::vector<ScalarType, A>, RHS>
00185     {
00186       typedef viennacl::vector<ScalarType, A>   ResultType;
00187     };
00188 
00189     //resolve ambiguities for previous cases:
00190     template <typename ScalarType, unsigned int A>
00191     struct VECTOR_EXTRACTOR_IMPL<viennacl::vector<ScalarType, A>, viennacl::vector<ScalarType, A> >
00192     {
00193       typedef viennacl::vector<ScalarType, A>   ResultType;
00194     };
00195 
00196     template <typename LHS, typename RHS>
00197     struct VECTOR_EXTRACTOR
00198     {
00199       typedef typename VECTOR_EXTRACTOR_IMPL<typename CONST_REMOVER<LHS>::ResultType,
00200                                               typename CONST_REMOVER<RHS>::ResultType>::ResultType      ResultType;
00201     };
00202 
00209     template <typename LHS, typename RHS, typename OP>
00210     struct VECTOR_SIZE_DEDUCER
00211     {
00212       //Standard case: LHS is the vector type and carries the correct size
00213       static unsigned int size(LHS & lhs, RHS & rhs) { return lhs.size(); }
00214     };
00215     
00216     //special case: matrix-vector product: Return the number of rows of the matrix
00217     template <typename MatrixType, typename ScalarType, unsigned int A>
00218     struct VECTOR_SIZE_DEDUCER<MatrixType, viennacl::vector<ScalarType, A>, viennacl::op_prod>
00219     {
00220       static unsigned int size(MatrixType & lhs, viennacl::vector<ScalarType, A> & rhs) { return lhs.size1(); }
00221     };
00222 
00223     //special case: matrix-vector product: Return the number of rows of the matrix
00224     template <typename MatrixType, typename ScalarType, unsigned int A>
00225     struct VECTOR_SIZE_DEDUCER<MatrixType, const viennacl::vector<ScalarType, A>, viennacl::op_prod>
00226     {
00227       static unsigned int size(MatrixType & lhs, const viennacl::vector<ScalarType, A> & rhs) { return lhs.size1(); }
00228     };

00237       typedef T       ResultType;

00241     struct CPU_SCALAR_TYPE_DEDUCER< viennacl::scalar<T> >
